revised_title: Effects of Tumors on Organ Weights in Rats and Mice
tldr: The author investigates the effects of tumor growth on the weights of organs in rats and mice. They find that the liver is hypertrophied in all cases, while the weight of the alimentary canal remains within or near the normal ratio. The study provides important insights into cancer metabolism and suggests promising directions for future research.
